definition: to set right/to correct
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: I must adjust my watch, it is slow.
sentences.chinese: 我必须把手表拨正，它慢了。

definition: (Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to hold the rudder/to hold (to take, to be at) the helm/to steer
crooked/askew/oblique/slanting/out of plumb
to throw away/to discard
to correct an error
rudder/helm of a ship
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
crooked/not upright/diverging from straight line/improper/dishonest
to set level/to lay flat
to adjust to the right value/to tune/to focus (a camera etc)/to set (the date, the time) to the correct value
to set sth upright or straight/to promote an employee from part-time to full-time (or from deputy to principal)/(old) to raise from concubine to wife status
to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
loose/flaking
to realize suddenly/to wake up to the truth/to suddenly awake from sleep
to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
